text: when I was 15 years old my best friend
and I we committed a carjacking in a
shopping mall parking lot and that crime
led us in front of a judge that would
give me eight years in adult maximum
security prisons you know when I was in
prison it was 18 bucks for a 15 minute
phone call my mom had to accept that
call and that rate charged to speak to
her only son
my mom told me Marcus I see you slipping
into this hopelessness and I want you to
know that there's definitely life after
prison and she made a promise to me to
either write me a letter or send me a
picture every day for the remaining six
years of my prison sentence
family connection is so important I
wanted Marcus to know that he had a
family he had friends on the outside
my mom's letters and pictures were
completely changed my life there are
millions of people that are living in
these prison cells who desire so
desperately to be able to be connected
to someone or something so we built a
mobile app that helps connect family
members to their incarcerated loved ones
our users are able to take a picture add
some quick text and for 99 cents we
print that picture and text on a real
tangible postcard and we ship it to any
person anywhere in the country
[Music]
flickshop is reaching out to other
partners to see how we can collaborate
together it raises the consciousness of
people within the organizations to
understand you know how important social
justice is most people will see just a
simple postcard but what they don't
realize is that there are organizations
that are sharing information about
health care plans or vaccination
information the Florida rights and
restoration Coalition the postcards that
they shipped out help influence the
voting population of Florida or even
some of our partners like Fremont's book
club who are helping to connect with
young people in sales all across the
country and keeping them connected back
to their community in very meaningful
ways free Minds uses creative arts to
build community and support our
currently and our previously
incarcerated members
right now currently we serve a thousand
members sometimes they need help with
jobs or food housing transportation we
try to find that support for them we use
click shop as our prison book club
program me and a couple of other peers
of Mines we run around doing all the
type of stuff we wasn't supposed to do
and they landed me in jail I did 13
years
and with flick shot when you get
pictures of the Martin Luther King
statue or more you and all that type of
stuff like that's a sense of home coming
to you it just cured that homesickness
just for a little bit
we built flick shop on AWS now we use
AWS machine learning technology to scan
each one of our photos to ensure that
we're capturing photo Contraband all the
way through how we're beginning to learn
how to synthesize all of these massive
pools of data so that we can organize it
and allow for our customers to be able
to engage with our platform in an
interesting way all of these features
were things that really honestly came
after eight years of my market research
um of living inside of these cells never
did I ever think about the fact that I
was sending him those pictures and
letters that it would come to where we
are today
flickshot postcards can be sent to your
neighbor across the street to Grandma to

in treatment centers now we're excited
about the next Frontier of what we're
building not only are we being
thoughtful about connecting you back to
your family and now connecting you back
to your potential employer but also the
folks who want to come home and be
entrepreneurs they're the before and I'm
the after I can't wait to be the model
for what it is that they can now see as
a possibility when they come home from
prison
as we look at everything that's

I see Flick shop uh really making a
